title: Haran
content: (1) Son of Terah and brother of Abraham. The father of Lot and also the father of Abraham’s wife Sarah (
), he died as the result of a severe famine in Ur of the Chaldees (

(3) The place of Abraham’s (Abram’s) first settlement on leaving Ur of the Chaldees; apparently named in memory of Abraham’s deceased brother Haran. It was a place of many flocks, and Terah, Abraham’s father, tarried there. The Lord appeared to Abraham at Haran (

). It was in the district near the source of the Euphrates and was a trading center of great importance, frequently mentioned in Assyrian inscriptions. It continued to be a flourishing city for many centuries.
